Narrative:
On November [XXX], 2024 at 2:33 PM PT a Waymo Autonomous Vehicle (Waymo AV) operating in San Francisco, California was in a collision involving a passenger car at a passenger drop-off lane near [XXX].
The Waymo AV was traveling north on [XXX] in the passenger drop-off lane at [XXX] when it approached a passenger car parked on the right side of the street. As the Waymo AV was passing the passenger car, the front driver side door of the passenger car opened and made contact with the front passenger side of the Waymo AV. At the time of the impact, the Waymo AVs Level 4 ADS was engaged in autonomous mode. The Waymo AV sustained damage.
Waymo is reporting this crash under Request No. 2 of Standing General Order 2021-01.  Waymo may supplement or correct its reporting with additional information as it may become available.

HMA was informed of this incident during a discussion with NHTSA's ODI on November [XXX], 2021. According to the information provided, a 2021 Kona EV was being operated by a non-production SAE Level 4 ADAS in an unknown mode when the Level 4 system experienced a communication error, switched to an auxiliary backup system, resulting in the vehicle crashing into a road sign/ pole.  The vehicle was undrivable post-crash.  No injuries were reported.
Hyundai notes that the subject vehicle was produced and sold with SAE Level 1 and below ADAS only.  
Hyundai also notes that it has not collaborated with Pony.ai since February 2020.
11/[XXX]/2021: No new updates available.
